title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Biosecurity
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Avian Influenza (Biosecurity 

measures) Regulations 2021 and come into operation on 17 November 2021.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited avian influenza (biosecurity measures) regulation 2021 come operation 17 november 2021

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: In these Regulations:-
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations:- 

“poultry” means birds kept in captivity for the production of meat or eggs for 
consumption, the production of other products, for restocking supplies of 
game birds or for the purposes of breeding for the production of these 
categories of birds; 

“other captive bird” means a bird other than poultry that is kept in captivity.
text_norm: 2 regulation - poultry mean bird kept captivity production meat egg consumption production product restocking supply game bird purpose breeding production category bird captive bird mean bird poultry kept captivity

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her
text_raw:
3. (1) A person who has poultry or other captive birds in his or her 
possession or under his or her control shall comply with the biosecurity 
measures- 

(a) 

(b) 

set out in Schedule1, and 

in the case of a person who has 500 or more poultry or other 
captive birds in his or her possession or under his or her control, 
the biosecurity measures set out in Schedule 2.
text_norm: 3 (1) person poultry captive bird possession control shall comply biosecurity measures- (a) (b) set schedule1 case person 500 poultry captive bird possession control biosecurity measure set schedule 2

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the
text_raw:
4. Regulation 3 is a penal provision to which section 36 (4) (b) of the

Schedule 1

Biosecurity measures

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or
text_raw:
2. 

All necessary measures to reduce the movement of people, vehicles or 
equipment to and from areas where poultry or other captive birds are 
kept. 

All necessary measures to minimise the risk that poultry or other 
captive birds will become affected with avian influenza through 
exposure to manure, slurry or other products. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 19th November, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [593] 3

heading: Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and
text_raw:
12. 

Effective vermin control, including preventing the entry of wild and 
domestic animals to land or premises where poultry or other captive 
birds are kept. 

Feed and bedding must be stored in such a manner that other animals, 
including wild birds, do not have access. 

A person who has contact with poultry or other captive birds must take 
all reasonable measures to avoid the transfer of avian influenza virus to 
or from land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept, 
including cleansing and disinfection of equipment, vehicles and 
footwear that has been in contact with poultry or other captive birds. 

Provide at all entry and exit points of land or premises where poultry or 
other captive birds are kept, disinfection points containing sufficient 
amount of a disinfectant that is effective against avian influenza virus 
used in accordance with the manufacturer’s guidelines. 

All necessary measures must be taken to prevent access by wild birds 
to land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept. 

Provide feed and water to poultry or other captive birds in such a way 
that is not accessible to wild birds. 

Take all necessary measures to prevent overgrowth of vegetation or 
accumulation of uncovered water on the land or premises. 

Remove anything that might attract wild birds from the premises such 
as fallen fruit or uneaten feed. 

Inspect the fabric and structural integrity of any building used to house 
poultry or other captive birds for holes and leaks, with particular 
emphasis on roofs, gutters and downpipes. Any holes and leaks must 
be repaired immediately to prevent water ingress. 

Take all necessary measures to thoroughly clean and disinfect housing 
and equipment at the end of each production cycle, using a disinfectant 
that is effective against avian influenza viruses in accordance with the 
manufacturer’s guidelines.
text_norm: 12 effective vermin control including preventing entry wild domestic animal land premise poultry captive bird kept feed bedding must stored manner animal including wild bird access person contact poultry captive bird must take reasonable measure avoid transfer avian influenza virus land premise poultry captive bird kept including cleansing disinfection equipment vehicle footwear contact poultry captive bird provide entry exit point land premise poultry captive bird kept disinfection point containing sufficient amount disinfectant effective avian influenza virus used accordance manufacturer guideline necessary measure must taken prevent access wild bird land premise poultry captive bird kept provide feed water poultry captive bird way accessible wild bird take necessary measure prevent overgrowth vegetation accumulation uncovered water land premise remove anything might attract wild bird premise fallen fruit uneaten feed inspect fabric structural integrity building used house poultry captive bird hole leak particular emphasis roof gutter downpipes hole leak must repaired immediately prevent water ingres take necessary measure thoroughly clean disinfect housing equipment end production cycle using disinfectant effective avian influenza virus accordance manufacturer guideline

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 13. Keep records of all persons and vehicles that enter land or premises
text_raw:
13. Keep records of all persons and vehicles that enter land or premises 

where poultry or other captive birds are kept.
text_norm: 13 keep record person vehicle enter land premise poultry captive bird kept

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 14. Keep records of movement of poultry, other captive bird and eggs onto
text_raw:
14. Keep records of movement of poultry, other captive bird and eggs onto 

or off land or premises. Records must include- 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

the quantity and description (including species of bird or type of 
egg), 

the date of each movement, 

the land or premises of destination, and 

the name and address of the person to whom consigned.
text_norm: 14 keep record movement poultry captive bird egg onto land premise record must include- (a) (b) (c) (d) quantity description (including specie bird type egg) date movement land premise destination name address person consigned

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 15. All outdoor areas where poultry and other captive birds have access to
text_raw:
15. All outdoor areas where poultry and other captive birds have access to 

must be fenced to confine the birds and must be managed to ensure- 

 
 4 [593] 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

(d) 

(e) 

(f) 

(g) 

(h) 

(i) 

(j) 

that the area is not contaminated with feathers or faecal material 
from wild birds and all reasonable steps are taken to remove 
such contamination that is present, 

access to open or permanent standing water is restricted by 
fencing off and netting ponds, standing water or waterlogged 
land to prevent access by poultry or other captive birds, 

there is no direct contact with other poultry or other captive 
birds, 

that ducks and geese are kept separately from other poultry 
species, 

that feed and water are kept indoors, 

poultry and other captive birds are fed indoors or under a 
covered area in a manner that prevents contact by wild birds 
with the feed and water, 

that measures are in place to ensure that wild birds are not 
attracted to areas in the vicinity of land or premises where 
poultry or other captive birds are located, in particular to 
watercourses, reservoirs, ponds or other standing water, 

that proactive measures are taken to discourage wild birds from 
entering the land or premises. For example streamers, bird 
scarers or foils, 

that the carcases of wild birds are removed immediately, and 

that regular cleansing and disinfection is carried out on all 
concrete walkways, paths and similar surfaces to which poultry 
and other captive birds, or wild birds have access. 

Schedule 2 

Regulation 3 (b) 

Additional biosecurity measures for land or premises with over 500 poultry or 
other captive birds.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: Land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept shall be
text_raw:
1. 

 Land or premises where poultry or other captive birds are kept shall be 
divided into 3 parts, as follows: 

(a) one part in which live birds are kept, 

(b) 

a part where ancillary activities, such as storage of feed, water 
and equipment are carried out, and 

(c) 

a restricted access part with a secure barrier.
text_norm: 1 land premise poultry captive bird kept shall divided 3 part follows (a) one part live bird kept (b) part ancillary activity storage feed water equipment carried (c) restricted access part secure barrier

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 2. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which
text_raw:
2. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which 

paragraph 1 (a) refers are - 

(a) 

access is restricted to essential personnel only, 

 
 
 
 [593] 5 

(b) 

(c) 

all persons must exercise effective barrier hygiene, including 
changing clothing and footwear before entering and on exit, 

the exterior of any vehicles, in particular wheels and wheel 
arches, and any equipment which enters or exits must be 
cleansed and disinfected on entry and exit, and 

(d) 

records must be maintained of vehicles and persons who enter 
or exit.
text_norm: 2 measure apply part land premise paragraph 1 (a) refers - (a) access restricted essential personnel 593 5 (b) (c) person must exercise effective barrier hygiene including changing clothing footwear entering exit exterior vehicle particular wheel wheel arch equipment enters exit must cleansed disinfected entry exit (d) record must maintained vehicle person enter exit

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 3. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which
text_raw:
3. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which 

paragraph 1 (b) refers are - 

(a) 

(b) 

access must be limited to essential personnel only with full 
biosecurity measures adopted on entry and exit, 

this part must be fully separated with clear demarcation from 
the part to which paragraph 1 (a) refers, 

(c) waste and carcases must be held in appropriately secure 
facilities in this part with clear separation from the other parts 
of the land or premises, 

(d) 

(e) 

the exterior of any vehicles, in particular wheels and wheel 
arches, and any equipment which enters or exits must be 
cleansed and disinfected on entry and exit, and 

egg producers must ensure the packing, handling and storage of 
second quality eggs is managed in a secure manner. Egg trays 
must be cleansed and disinfected before use.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: 4. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which
text_raw:
4. The measures that apply in a part of land or premises to which 
paragraph 1 (c) refers are access must be limited to essential persons 
and vehicles with full biosecurity measures adopted on entry and exit. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal of the Minister for 
Agriculture, Food and the Marine, 

15 November, 2021. 

BRENDAN GLEESON, 

An officer authorised to authenticate the official Seal of 
the Minister.

title: conferred on him by section 36 of the Animal Health and Welfare Act 2013
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation) 

These Regulations provide for the biosecurity measures for poultry and other 
captive birds as a precautionary measure against risk of avian influenza. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [593] 7
